bill_title: revise certain provisions regarding certification of utility permits.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions regarding certification of utility permits. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 49-41B-27 be amended to read: 49-41B-27. Utilities which that have acquired a permit in accordance with the provisions of this chapter may proceed to improve, expand, or construct the facility for the intended purposes at any time, subject to the provisions of this chapter; provided, however, that if such construction, expansion and improvement commences more than four years after a permit has been issued, then the utility must certify to the Public Utilities Commission that such the facility continues to meet the conditions upon which the permit was issued under the original issuance of the permit. Upon receipt of a request for certification under this section, the commission shall follow the procedures for a contested case set forth in chapter 1-26. For certification to be granted, the applicant shall present substantial evidence of its history of compliance with all prior commission permit conditions. The commission shall consider the prior performance of the applicant on similar projects, including past violations of applicable state, federal, and tribal laws or regulations. A certification by the commission under this section shall be subject to judicial review in the circuit court under the provisions of chapter 1-26.
